comment: he is a great professor! definitely take him for CSE 1321; he makes everything understandable. his lectures aren't super interesting but his examples he shows in lecture are very helpful. both the midterm and final uses the same question bank as the weekly quizzes, so you knew exactly what to study.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Had Dmitri for lab and lecture and I would say that he is best professor to have for this course. He answers all questions, very clear lectures, and values students' feedback on the course. Very understanding, I recommend him 100%
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: John Blake was a good GTA for this class. Attendance was not required; I attended class because he explained labs(13),assignments(7) & to receive assistance from the CCSE tutors during class. I recommend watching the provided videos&typing along.The final exam was significantly better than the poorly written midterm.Overall, I enjoyed the course.
Nice professor. Everything is accessible outside the class. Tests and quizzes are easy if prepared.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Does an amazing job of using examples to explain topics, and does a good job of explaining possible real-world resources as well. Provides a bunch of examples and even coding exercises for each unit.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Solid professor and easily accessible, easy to talk to if you need help. Had him for 1322.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: For his 1322 class. He is very passionate about coding & offers insightful lectures. Will answer questions about code quirks & other tidbits. Sometimes, he will lecture quicker than scheduled & devote days to in-class programming, which is great for improving your skills. Grading is like the rest of FYE - quizzes & exams, no extra credit.
Honestly, if you want a teacher who is easy to understand, can ask questions comfortably, and is respectable, choose this professor. 100% wont regret it!!!
His lecture were very clear and he always posted any code he did in class. Not much chance to get involved in discussion most of the time which lead to some boring lectures.

His lectures are very interesting and clear even though the class can get a bit hard towards the end. He often does in-class work which is fun. Class is only graded by online quizzes, 2 tests and the final. The final is worth 25% and then replaces your lowest test grade.  So make sure to do good on the final. Overall he is great !
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Very happy with the class and Professor Nunes. He is succinct, but also happy to take questions and slow things down if needed. There's always a line of students at his desk before and after class to get input on either a class exercise or lab assignment.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best computer science professors I've had he's great with communication usually replies around 10min he definitely works with you if you're struggling his lectures are pretty informative cares about your success just make sure to double down on studying for those coding exams they definitely don't play around utilize your resources.
